content.description: An experiment to evaluate the efficiency of wet and dry scrubber networks that filter particulate gas at different flow rates was conducted under different flow rate conditions. The results are shown below.
content.question: Based on the data in the graph, which of the following methods would be most effective at removing the greatest amount of particulate matter from coal-burning power plant emissions?

choices.label: Dry scrubbers using a flow rate of <math alttext="200 liters per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>min</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> are best suited to remove small particles.

Dry scrubbers using a flow rate of <math alttext="450 liters per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>min</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> are best suited to remove large particles.

Wet scrubbers using a flow rate of <math alttext="300 liters per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>min</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> are best suited to remove small particles.

Wet scrubbers using a flow rate of <math alttext="450 liters per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>min</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> are best suited to remove large particles.

content.answer: Wet scrubbers using a flow rate of <math alttext="450 liters per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>450</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>min</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> are best suited to remove large particles.

skill.text: Skill 7.D: Use data and evidence to support a potential solution.
